programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A hand-painted, signed guitar from Def Leppard's Phil Collen rocks into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed platinum disc from glam metal band Poison has Rick wondering whether it is worth adding to his record collection.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a 1920s radio and make a deal to repair an ice-cream seller's bicycle from the 1940s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his son compete to see who can restore a vintage scooter the fastest, while the team fixes a vending machine.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Jim and Bill Vieira track promising leads on the Goshen Mystery Tunnel site, and a giant skeleton found in 1849.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of business traveller Greg Fleniken, who was found dead in his Texas hotel room in September 2010. At first, all signs pointed to a heart attack, but police learned he had been murdered when the medical examiner reported that the body had severe internal damage, with broken ribs, lacerations to the liver and scrotum, and a hole in the heart, all caused by blunt force trauma.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates growing numbers of flying orbs sightings, with witnesses also experiencing odd dreams, premonitions and deep fear.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The theory that aliens might have told Joan of Arc how to beat the English army, and whether an American serviceman received a message when he touched a spaceship.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: First episode of the series in which Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team try to make a profit out of fixing, restoring and transforming unusual objects.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Tyler struggles to stick to his budget during the restoration of a 1930s Eco-Tyre Meter, while Rick gets to work on a storm-damaged street lamp.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman coin from 44 BC featuring Julius Caesar's portrait is brought into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether the owner will command a high price.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys head down to the shooting range to try out a pair of Duck's Foot pistols, where Chum sets out to prove he is a crack shot.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi attends an auction without Jarrod, who has no idea what she intends to spend their money on. Darrell finds a kit that could brew him a nice profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four previously eliminated bladesmiths return to the forge for a shot at redemption, but face a challenge more difficult than the had ever imagined.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team members attempt to uncover the US military's first responses to UFO encounters, prompting them to revisit a suspected UFO crash site in California.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating claims that the Third Reich used extraterrestrial technology, and a speculative report asking whether the legend of Atlantis could be a preserved memory of an ancient alien metropolis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head for an auction in Costa Mesa, where they encounter several new faces. Brandi and Jarrod look for stock to sell in their new shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick saddles up and heads out to look at a 1980s Sigma Derby horse racing game, but it remains to be seen whether it will be worth a gamble.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum is over the moon when a pair of 1960s space robot toys arrive at the shop, but the owners asking price may bring him back down to Earth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi attends an auction without Jarrod, who has no idea what she intends to spend their money on. Darrell finds a kit that could brew him a nice profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version. Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher and comedians Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on topics related to Christmas, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Suzi Ruffell. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he lumps together a whole host of topics, from lava lamps to love handles. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedy writer and actor David Mitchell, impressionist Ronni Ancona and stand-up Jimmy Carr.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended version. Star Wars actress Carrie Fisher and comedians Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies for a festive edition of the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks them a range of unusual questions on topics related to Christmas, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Al Murray and Nish Kumar, presenter Anneka Rice and Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo continue the daily test of their general knowledge skills, hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Suzi Ruffell. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following a successful pilot scheme trailing the use of body cameras, Staffordshire Police officers are now wearing them on patrol to increase transparency and bring offenders to justice. The series provides a hard-hitting mixture of bodycam and observational footage, reflecting the daily challenges of combating crime and revealing fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When they uncover one of the rarest motorcycles in the world, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz must muster more cash than ever to seal the deal.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Scott, Brandon and Lori hope to strike it rich in Las Vegas, but Dustin and Dan are betting big too.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Dustin continues to pose a threat to Brandon and Lori in Las Vegas.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While combing through an impressive collection, Mike finds a rare Ford, and the guys pick a Tennessee home hiding a big secret.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore South Carolina, where they are tempted by a spaceship clock.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: When Steve is commissioned to build a spooky car, he digs up a haunted '55 Chevy, and Justin and Travis battle to modify it. Steve and Merlon flip a Depression-era Plymouth.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters hit the road in a Jensen-Healey, a Lotus and a TVR as they chart the decline of the British sports car industry, on a journey from Norfolk to Blackpool. On the test track, Jeremy Clarkson enthuses about the Ferrari 458 Italia, and actor Jeff Goldblum is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Staffordshire Police officers encounter a man who fancies some late-night shopping in Stoke, smashing his way through a shop front with an axe.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Major body work is needed when the suspension and engine don't fit the Haunted Rod. Steve flips a 1920 Old Wayne Gas Pump to offset extra labour costs.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan, Matt Lucas and Liza Tarbuck join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the unconventional quiz. This time, the focus falls on the theme 'Odds and Ends'. During the course of the show, the panellists learn how to tell a schnauzerorgan from a paddywhack. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Mel Giedroyc, Jason Manford, Sarah Millican, Stephen Mangan, Dermot O'Leary, Charles Dance, Warwick Davis, David Harewood, Bob Mortimer, David O'Doherty and Joanna Scanlan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Guests Miranda Hart, Stephen Mangan, Barry Cryer and Miles Jupp join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Frankie Boyle, Jack Carroll, Holly Walsh
programme.desc: Glaswegian comedian Frankie Boyle introduces young stand-up sensation Jack Carroll, who rose to fame on Britain's Got Talent in 2013. Holly Walsh will also be taking to the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies invites all five contestants to have some global fun with a beach ball, while Lou Sanders has some wise words for the youth of today. Plus, Paul Sinha tries to invent a revolutionary new use for a basketball, and Sian Gibson attempts to rescue Little Alex Horne from the sharp beak of an aquatic bird.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of luck and loss. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson and broadcasters Sandi Toksvig and Danny Baker, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the multisized worlds of the little and the large. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and stand-ups Lucy Porter and Phill Jupitus, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: King John's Ruin - Peak District
programme.desc: As the 800th anniversary of the signing of Magna Carta in June 1215 approaches, Tony Robinson sets out to discover the real King John. His walk across the medieval monarch's stamping grounds of Sherwood Forest and the Peak District reveals a hapless man stumbling from crisis to crisis who, in the end, had no choice but to sign away some of his power. In the midst of what are now cultivated fields, Tony finds the scant remains of Laxton Castle, once the control centre where strict 'forest law' was administered and where taxes and fines flooded into the royal coffers. Later, in Sherwood, he explores how the myth of Robin Hood has helped to skew the public's image of King John.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Jerusalem in search of Solomon's Temple. When the Romans sacked the city in 70AD, the fabled Treasure of Solomons was believed to have been looted and taken back to Rome. However, it is possible it was hidden away by the High Priests. Archaeologists Dr Shimon Gibson and Kate Raphael have dedicated their lives working out what actually happened, and discuss whether it is possible that Solomonic and Roman treasures lie undiscovered under Jerusalem.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A multi-billion-pound 32km super sewer under the streets of London, an early sewer system at the Palace of Knossos and a pivotal piece of tunnel boring equipment from the past.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Drama set in 1895, chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. The first episode sees Eleanor embarking on her medical career _ and immediately crossing swords with eminent surgeon Sir Herbert Hamilton. Jemma Redgrave stars in the title role, with David Calder as her father, and Robert Hardy as Sir Herbert.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colette is overjoyed to learn that the Fusiliers will shortly be leaving for South Africa, and tries to persuade Joe that it would be the ideal place to get married. Marsha learns that Michael has been having an affair and resolves to fight for him, no matter what it takes.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Complications arise during Tricia's mastectomy and she is rushed to Holby, to the surprise of Chrissie, who also discovers Carlos plans to leave. Mickie is reunited with her mother and Owen suggests to Diane that they have a baby together. Will continues torturing himself over the death of a patient, and decides to quit - but Connie refuses to accept his resignation.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is attacked by a dog, placing the unborn child's life in danger. A groom collapses at the altar with an epileptic fit, while Gloria deals with an infected pierced belly button and later accepts an offer of a drink from Richard.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Yvonne is horrified to learn Beverley was assaulted by her own husband and promptly alerts CID, only for the case to take an unexpected twist when the culprit insists he acted in self-defence. Jim puts his marriage on the line by succumbing to his gambling addiction yet again, despite a stern lecture from June and threats from an angry loan shark. Jack returns to Sun Hill, determined to reassert his status as top cop, but his colleagues doubt whether he has fully recovered from his heart attack.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat plays surrogate mother to Mandy. Will Frank play the father role?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark makes a decision about his future which proves unpopular with Pauline. Could Gill be the one to change his mind? Sam and Ricky are in for a shock at the squat.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: While hosting an opening day for the local children, the team are held hostage in the station by a gang of armed criminals. Starring Mark Arden and Sean Blowers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they haven't broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim attempts to investigate a robbery, but finds it tough going with only the slenderest of leads to follow. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The employees are insulted by a suggestion that they take a wage cut, and decide to hold a rooftop demonstration. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A middle-class couple's adopted child is kidnapped, a case that takes Gently and Bacchus to a home where unmarried mothers are forced to give up their babies. Suspicion initially falls upon the natural mother, who is thought to have 'stolen' her baby back. But further investigations reveal a much darker side to the adoption home itself and raise questions as to how far this seemingly perfect couple were prepared to go to become parents. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Mark Gatiss, Helen Baxendale and Alison Steadman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A young boy falls into a creek and drowns, while his mother is found slumped in the hallway. Dr Stephen Andrews discovers both ingested rat poison, and suspicion falls on the grieving husband and father. The detective soon uncovers a sordid case of extortion and forgery as part of his investigation. Crime drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Another selection of clips showcasing what can go wrong on holiday, including an unexpected visitor to a couple's tent on their safari holiday, footage from a GoPro camera lost at sea, and a man who took a flight to the edge of space.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Comedian and matchmaking game show host Paddy McGuinness, MasterChef's Gregg Wallace, and former Gogglebox star and one-time Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt form the panel this week, as Keith Lemon ventures unbidden into another three mystery celebrities' homes. Keith explores the residences pointing out tell-tale clues, before challenging his trio of stars to guess 'who habitates in a house like this'.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Tech Abuse: Stopping the Stalkers - Tonight
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham explores the growing issue of 'cyber-stalking'. She asks what can be done to prevent technology being used in this way and talks to cyber-crime experts to find out how easy it is for an abuser to take control of their partner's technology.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Blackpool, where Tracy Thackray-Howitt gets a very cheeky chappy and Jo Brayshaw gets flattered into parting with her cash. Plus, for once, a tableful of bling doesn't do it for Henry Nicholls.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which members of a baseball team from Newport answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Clarissa, Bob, Mark and Lai work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane returns with some news, Noah and Sarah unite, and Graham hides the truth.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally's hot tub hosts an awkward reunion for Tracy, while Gemma and Chesney discover they are easily replaceable. Elsewhere, Aggie explains her change of career to Roy.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Despite many summer holidays on the islands, Julia doesn't know too much about the real Greece, so here explores the hidden side of the dazzling, sun-drenched Greek Islands. She begins in picturesque Crete, intending to step away from the tourist trail, by exploring the Dikti mountains and its striking plateau of windmills. She meets goat shepherd Giannis, who shows her how he makes cheese using traditional methods. Her journey ends on the stunning but poignant neighbouring island of Spinalonga - once an exiled leper colony.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy confesses all to a horrified Steve, and Bernie's meddling sends Dev into a rage. Meanwhile, Cathy confides in Brian about her concerns for Yasmeen.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a student from a prestigious all-female college is found dead, Will and Geordie infiltrate the murky world of campus politics and university societies to find the killer. Navigating strange initiations, raucous parties - and with investigative journalist, Ellie Harding, hot on their heels - they need to use every advantage at their disposal to unravel the mystery. Cathy's ambitions for a life of her own start to test the delicate family balance, while fresh from a spell with Daniel in Marrakech, Leonard finds it hard to acclimatise to life back in Grantchester. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star.

programme.title: The National Television Awards Celebrate 25 Years
programme.desc: Julie Walters narrates a look back at the long-running awards show. Previous hosts Trevor McDonald and Dermot O'Leary share their memories of anchoring the event, while their successor, David Walliams, looks ahead to taking the reins for the 2020 show. Among the stars sharing their memories of past awards ceremonies are Graham Norton, Ant & Dec, Holly Willoughby, David Tennant, Simon Cowell, Paul O'Grady, Richard & Judy, Danny Dyer, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Brendan O'Carroll, Phillip Schofield, Julie Hesmondhalgh, Michael Barrymore, Eamonn Holmes and Davina McCall.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following on from the launch show over Christmas, Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the start of the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and new addition John 'Fabulous' Barrowman. This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how to make Parmesan cheese, and the key to keeping the runways operating at the world's busiest airports. Plus, manufacturing reclining chairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Bill Warner of the Amelia Island Concours asks Wayne to present his Davis three-Wheeler at a show, but his schedule only permits eight weeks to restore the car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini makes a costly mistake when he decides to put up for auction a classic '64 Cobra without a reserve price.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Eerie Eruption, Slippery Slope, Downstream Disaster
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A race car loses control at 150mph, a biplane crashes into a crowded lake, trains slam into trucks, and a wall falls on a worker. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado rips into a factory, barrels of turpentine explode, one of the world's fastest boats crashes upside down, and a helicopter pilot makes a serious error.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: A veteran driver is in grave danger when his truck flips, Eldon takes a chance on a new logging camp, and flooding in the forest threatens to shut down operations.

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Highlights of day six from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how marble is produced, the building of escape slides and how mah-jong pieces are made.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Fine art sculptor Nick must be extra careful as he uses a drill to restore a 19th-century urn. Lighting specialist Jolene is challenged by Drew to repair a funfair display.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon Lovegrove search a Cornish surf shack, where they find a bevy of custom bikes, surf buggies and all kinds of weird and wonderful objects. Is there a nice little earner lurking in Cornwall?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Cornwall for more sheds and more rummaging. On Bodmin Moor, James has accumulated his collection over 25 years, which includes everything from motorbikes to amphibious craft. Can the boys score a deal?.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tanker driver Sludge tries to dodge disaster, while Steve Graham suffers from his worst nightmare on the road, and rough weather places Macca McReady in jeopardy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than 4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sully and Broomey race to move two 38-ton excavators from Bristol to Aldermaston in Berkshire, but mechanical problems threaten to stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson examines bizarre markings that suggest a violent clash between prehistoric beasts, and in California, he investigates whether a strange lake might be home to alien life.

programme.title: Live Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day seven from indigo at the O2 in London, featuring two men's quarter-finals and a ladies' semi-final.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Graham finds himself up the creek without a paddle on a desert island delivery. Yogi runs out of road, and two concrete specialists head off the map and into trouble.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Sculptor Nick has his skills stretched by an equestrian piece with classical connections. Plus, leather expert Martin works on a piece of luggage once owned by Russian royalty.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: A hunt for fresh stock takes Drew Pritchard to the Cotswolds, where he finds a giant stash of Indian and Afghan treasures which have come directly from the subcontinent..

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Lost Giants of Georgia/Bridge of Death
programme.desc: In the Borjami Valley, experts uncover bones they believe belong to a human over nine feet tall. Plus, investigating why dogs have been mysteriously jumping from a bridge.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: New data reveals a super comet that will slam into the moon with enough force to jar it out of orbit. This programme examines how Earth will survive.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at ways to weave an authentic Turkish carpet, and how helicopter blade technology is being used to make cross country skis. Plus, the practicalities behind the Niagara Falls.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: A venerable young man, allowed to live independently for the first time, is murdered in cold blood at the hands of a couple playing a truly warped game of deceit and lies.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three case studies showing the lengths to which investigators will go to catch the killers of people classed as missing and presumed dead.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The 1999 box-office hit shocked viewers with the film's mind-bending plot. In 2003, Joshua Cooke said he lived in The Matrix when he murdered his parents.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of retired Michigan police officer Michael Greene and his wife Terri in their home. Police found evidence of a personal grudge as a possible motive for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The co-ordination of law enforcement agencies throughout the USA to apprehend a couple who embarked on a murderous crime spree in the summer of 1984.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A litter of puppies is struck by the parvo virus, while officers shoot to kill when a cop is attacked by a vicious dog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to understand what has happened to a shih tzu cross after it was found to be bleeding internally while being groomed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to save Jonti the cat, which has suffered a gaping neck wound after playing with the family dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer tries to reconcile her personal style with her desire to be a very traditional bride, and another woman hopes her grandmother approves of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Katie wants a mermaid-style dress, but her mother would prefer to see her in a traditional ballgown. Consultant Jenny is left trying to find a compromise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country girl Elizabeth admits she is more comfortable with hunting than dress shopping, while Christina's father does not respond well to a photo of his daughter in her dream dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Peter needs to remove a grass seed from a dog's eye. Dr Alex tries to fix a traumatised puppy that has been attacked and a massive dog comes in for a check-up.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The officers come to the rescue of six hungry horses, and try to rehouse an elderly grey mare called Grandma.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis finds a neglected pair of horses and a donkey, prompting the SPCA to battle for custody of the animals in court.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items from Dunbar Recycling Centre, enlisting the help of Norman Wilkinson to take on some broken fencing and asking lighting expert Guy Trench to make a set of glass demijohns shine again. Sarah has an arduous task to revamp a fire damaged table, but will all of their hard work be enough to turn these curious cast-offs into cash?.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The case of a missing Californian teenager, who was presumed to have run away. However, her body turned up in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the police recover a submerged car belonging to a man reported missing, they are perturbed to discover a pair of broken glasses on the floor but no body.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 27-year-old Tracy Ocasio, who went missing from West Orlando, Florida, in May 2009. On the night of her disappearance she was seen in the company of a man currently serving a life sentence for the attempted murder of another woman. When one of her boots was found in woodland detectives searched the area, but no body was recovered.

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass examine the case of Edith Thompson, who was convicted of murdering her husband Percy and sentenced to death in 1922.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Leah, a former model, is assigned to consultant Dianne, who is challenged by her opinionated maid-of-honour.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Debbie and Carmel team up to sell dresses to sister brides, but one of them would rather work alone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman who lost her mother to breast cancer battles her opinionated aunt, while Ellen falls for a dress that might be beyond her means.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Julie and her mother cannot hold back when it comes to their brutal opinions, while brides-to-be Joy and Beth have high expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A woman returns a ballroom-style dress so that she can buy one that better suits her edgy tastes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel desperately needs a sale to hit her monthly goal, while Keasha works with bride-to-be Heidi who recently donated a kidney to her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bre is set on a traditional gown, while Jennifer knows the exact dress for her. Elsewhere, Susan finally gets to make her dream wedding a reality after a 20-year wait.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tiffany's choice of a hot pink gown is proving controversial with her mother, while second-time bride Holly attends her fitting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a remote part of Scotland for an epic private house clearance and calls in at an historic cutlery factory in Sheffield.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items from Dunbar Recycling Centre, enlisting the help of Norman Wilkinson to take on some broken fencing and asking lighting expert Guy Trench to make a set of glass demijohns shine again. Sarah has an arduous task to revamp a fire damaged table, but will all of their hard work be enough to turn these curious cast-offs into cash?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Melissa deals with an unplanned pregnancy, and Ashley seeks new inspiration when her weight loss grinds to a halt.

programme.title: Murder Made Me Famous
programme.desc: The 1989 killings of Hollywood media mogul Jose Menendez and his wife Kitty, which became a national media event when the couple's two privileged young sons, Lyle and Erik, confessed to the shotgun murders.

programme.title: The Coroner: I Speak for the Dead
programme.desc: The case of Hitender Thakur, who was found shot to death. It fell to Coroner Graham Hetrick to help police hunt a killer who had disappeared without a trace.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.
